Description: Fragment of rim and floor, mended from four sherds, of East Greek pottery plate or standed plate; interior, from outside: band of dots; broad black band with added red and white lines, worn; maeander frieze; band with added red band; in tondo, one lotus bud and a dot preserved; exterior: outside of rim glazed; six thin bands preserved on wall.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1162)
